result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis John Dauer

defendant.name: Dauer, Curtis John
defendant.address: 2903 West Pierce Street # Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53215

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtis John Dauer in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Curtis John Dauer.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Court grants request.
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Curtis John Dauer in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Curtis John Dauer.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Attorney Rosenthal was recently appointed and needs discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 2nd, 2022

Defendant Curtis John Dauer in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim(s) present.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have counsel. Court refers Defendant to State Public Defender's Office. Defendant requests time to obtain private counsel.
Defendant needs to have private counsel by 9/19/22 OR must go to the State Public Defender's Office to obtain counsel, if eligible. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CDT and PW.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Curtis John Dauer in court.   Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to  Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/12/2022@2pm
